intro: Discomela angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved discomela, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
